name: CreateGithubDeploymentBranchPolicy
description:
Creates a deployment branch policy for a GitHub environment.

This tool is used to create a deployment branch policy within a specified environment on GitHub. It requires authentication with a valid access token with the 'repo' scope or a GitHub App with 'administration:write' permission for the repository.

parameters.name: repository_owner
parameters.description: The account owner of the repository. Case insensitive.

value_schema.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.name: repository_name
parameters.description: The name of the GitHub repository, not case sensitive.

value_schema.description: The name of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.name: environment_name
parameters.description: The name of the environment for which to create a deployment branch policy.

parameters.name: branch_name_pattern
parameters.description: A pattern that branches must match to deploy to the environment. Wildcard characters won't match '/'.

value_schema.description:
The name pattern that branches must match in order to deploy to the environment.

Wildcard characters will not match `/`. For example, to match branches that begin with `release/` and contain an additional single slash, use `release/*/*`.
For more information about pattern matching syntax, see the [Ruby File.fnmatch documentation](https://ruby-doc.org/core-2.5.1/File.html#method-c-fnmatch).
